questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Viruses are nonliving infectious agents.
questions.explanation: True. Viruses are considered nonliving because they are acellular and cannot reproduce or carry out metabolic functions without a host cell.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Viruses only contain RNA.
questions.explanation: False. A virus can have either DNA or RNA as its genetic material, but not both.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Viruses are known as infectious agents because they need a host to gain ATP and to reproduce.
questions.explanation: True. Viruses are obligate intracellular parasites, meaning they rely entirely on the host cell's machinery for energy (ATP) and replication.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Viroids are only found in plants.
questions.explanation: False. While most known viroids are plant pathogens, some have been discovered in fungi as well.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: A prion is comprised of a protein and RNA.
questions.explanation: False. Prions are infectious agents composed entirely of a misfolded protein; they do not contain any nucleic acid (RNA or DNA).
